Experience

  • Coursera

    Software Engineer on the analytics team. Developed and maintained ETL systems for aggregating data from multiple sources of raw data such as RDS, Cassandra, log files and third party tools into the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) using Amazon DataPipeline and EMR.

    Backend development in Scala, PHP and Python for various data products such as data dashboards and learner surveys.

  • Georgia Tech

    Research on application of machine learning and statistics for portfolio hedging and trading algorithms. Focus on creating low-risk, continues-return based trading strategies. Also developed the QSTK python library.

    Teaching assistant for the coursera course Computational Investing -1. The course has had more than 110,000 students enrolled. The class was featured on the 11 Alive News and the Atlanta Journal Constitution. Involved in creating assignments, class website, video lectures, and development of QSTK library used in the course.

    Teaching assistant for Machine Learning for Trading class. Involved in creating assignment, exams and conducting recitation sessions.

  • Lucena Research

    Software developer and Quant Analyst at an early stage start-up. Lucena applies machine learning and pattern recognition to financial data. Developed the python backend and various algorithms for the web application.

  • BITS Pilani

    Teaching assistant for Computer programming and Engineering graphics classes. Undergraduate researcher in the electrical and electronics department, worked on image and video processing algorithms.

  • Analog Devices

    Designed a low cost prototype that can be used to control a stereo image in real time using motion capture from accelerometers and gyroscopes.

  • Larsen and Toubro

    Automation of a 600km Dahej Vijaypur gas pipeline. Designed, programmed and tested the PLC panels.
